text: Utah's 4th congressional district is a congressional district created by the state legislature after the 2010 census. Some 85% of the new district is in Salt Lake County and it includes a portion of Salt Lake City. == List of members representing the district == Member Party Years Cong ress Electoral history Counties District established January 3, 2013 District established January 3, 2013 District established January 3, 2013 District established January 3, 2013 District established January 3, 2013 District established January 3, 2013 Jim Matheson Democratic January 3, 2013 – January 3, 2015 Redistricted from the and re-elected in 2012. Retired. 2013–2023 Parts of Juab, Salt Lake, Sanpete, and Utah Mia Love Republican January 3, 2015 – January 3, 2019 Elected in 2014. Re-elected in 2016. Lost re-election. 2013–2023 Parts of Juab, Salt Lake, Sanpete, and Utah Ben McAdams Democratic January 3, 2019 – January 3, 2021 Elected in 2018. Lost re-election. 2013–2023 Parts of Juab, Salt Lake, Sanpete, and Utah Burgess Owens Republican January 3, 2021 – present Elected in 2020. Re-elected in 2022. Re-elected in 2024. 2013–2023 Parts of Juab, Salt Lake, Sanpete, and Utah Burgess Owens Republican January 3, 2021 – present Elected in 2020. Re-elected in 2022. Re-elected in 2024. 2023–present Sanpete; parts of Juab, Salt Lake, and Utah ==References== Category:Congressional districts of Utah
title: Utah's 4th congressional district
